messages.content: You are a helpful AI assistant. You're given a text and answer if the context is about a new cyber security threats, and describe the threat

is there any new cyber threat based on this text: A new #0day LPE exploit for Windows is being advertised by a user named Zac (aka Vinki) on underground forums. The #exploit bypasses UAC and works from a low integrity level. All modern versions of Windows OS and Windows Server are affected.
Yes, a new zero-day exploid has been discovered. LPE exploit can bypass UAC and works from a low integrity level. All Windows OS and Windows Server are affected
You are a helpful AI assistant. You're given a text and answer if the context is about a new cyber security threats, and describe the threat

is there any new cyber threat based on this text: Group-IB Threat intelligence discovers a new 0-day in #WinRAR used to target traders #CVE-2023-38831 allows TAs to spoof file extensions and hide the launch of malicious script within a ZIP archive masquerading as a '.jpg', '.txt', and other formats http://bit.ly/45fFq44
Yes, a new zero-day vulnerability is found in WinRAR. CVE-2023-38831 let hackers to fake the file extensions as '.jpg' and other formats within the ZIP archive to launch attack

is there any new cyber threat based on this text: It is nothing but a slightly modified data sample dumped by another TA on the same forum in July 2023 under the name “Chinese customers data - 2023”. Group-IB's Threat Intel unit established this connection by searching unusual keywords in this data sample posted by #ChinaLeak

is there any new cyber threat based on this text: We've launched a new blog series, Hunting Rituals, which explores hunting techniques using one of the most effective solutions on the market — Group-IB MXDR. In the first article, we detailed the basic techniques for detecting DLL sideloading, a cunning method used to evade traditional security measures. Follow our step-by-step guide
No, this is an announcement about a new blog series about threats hunting

is there any new cyber threat based on this text: #Gigabud #RAT is out there expanding its capabilities and targets. Our team recently dissected the fraudulent techniques employed by Gigabuds operators, using the Group-IB Fraud Matrix. The detailed investigation uncovered more than 400 separate Gigabud.RAT samples, and we outline how the #trojan operates, its previously unknown variants, and the potential risks to organizations, particularly across the Asia-Pacific region. Dive into the full investigation here:
No, the tweet is about a new detail investigation on Gigabud.RAT trojan

is there any new cyber threat based on this text: #Phoenix #keylogger has returned. On Monday the actor 'koeir' on XSS forum announced new version of Phoenix Revolution #Stealer (coded in C#). This Stealer was active in 2019-2020. It runs in memory, weighs less than 300 KB.
No, this is just an update of the current virus Phoenix Revolution

is there any new cyber threat based on this text: A new critical #Microsoft Outlook vulnerability CVE-2023-23397 has been reported by CERT-UA. The #exploit was used to bypass NTLM authentication and gain unauthorized access to an internal network using an intercepted account.
Yes, A new exploit CVE-2023-23397 has been discovered on Outlook that can access to internal network
